intro: Silphium lapsum, commonly known as the common silphium, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces small, yellow to reddish-orange flowers that bloom in summer, attracting various pollinators. Silphium lapsum typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open woodlands and grasslands. It has a long history of use in traditional medicine and as a source of edible seeds.
